data.title: Remove Game.ModData references from Widget code.
data.body: The main focus of this change is code hygiene (relying on a static reference for something which may change isn't nice), but has a side-effect of adding support for map-defined resources in the editor.

data.title: Fixed game end when admin leaves on dedicated server
data.body:
Instead a new admin is found and all bots are handed over. You can use `launch-dedicated.sh` and `launch-game.sh` to quickly setup a test environment with 1 dedicated server and 2 clients.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10515.

data.title: Remove internal use of map paths.
data.body:
Some important refactoring in preparation for the next round of filesystem/map cleanups.  This replaces the string file paths everywhere with a reference to a map package (which are stored/owned by a MapPreview, and exist for the lifetime of the ModData).

This is the last major set of plumbing work to support oramods.  The remaining steps are either localized cleanups (in the map enumeration and editor code), or pure additions (adding support for mounting sub-directories inside a zip file).

data.title: Add terrain height support to WithShadow.
data.body: Fixes #10784.

data.title: WithShadow is not heightmap aware
data.body: Shadows are always rendered at z == 0.  This is particularly in the Shattered Paradise mod which uses it on most of the scrin units.

data.title: Production widget for specs
data.body: [In a recent video by SoScared on Youtube](https://youtu.be/0IDixZguIP0?t=323) he overlaid the production breakdown on the top left of the screen, it would be cool to see this as a built in feature, and show all players when you're in the all players/disable shroud perspective and only the player you're in perspective of when viewing from player perspective.

data.title: Build queue indicators for specs
data.body: Currently in the production tab you can see what a player is currently building, I don't know if it would be possible as I don't know how the queueing works, but it would be nice to see an indicator of what's in the build queue, even if it just shows the number indicator if the same item is queued up rather than a complete breakdown of individual items.

data.title: Fix filesystem references under Windows.
data.body: Fixes scripted maps, and the TS mod crashes under Windows.

data.title: mpspawn not shown in editor for "Neutral" until switching to different faction and back
data.body:
Testing latest bleed(just updated).
OS: Debian testing
Mono 4.2.1

What I did:

1) Start the map editor. Create a new map or load it
2) Go to actors
3) Note that the default faction is "Neutral"

What I expected:
mpspawn is one of the actors I can place

What I saw:
mpspawn and some other special actors are not present. If I switch to "Creeps" and then switch back, I do see mpspawn and the other actors present for "Neutral".

The result of this was that at first I thought I could only place mpspawn as Creeps, and that that's what I was supposed to do. Seems clearly a bug if others can reproduce it.

Closes #10741.

Missiles can now descend towards CruiseAltitude as well.

```
Exception of type 'System.ArgumentException': The value -1697 is invalid for red. red must be >= 0 and <= 255.

   at System.Linq.Enumerable.ToDictionary[TSource,TKey,TElement](IEnumerable'1 source, Func'2 keySelector, Func'2 elementSelector)
   at OpenRA.Graphics.PlayerColorRemap..ctor(Int32[] ramp, HSLColor c, Single rampFraction) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\PlayerColorRemap.cs:line 46.
   at OpenRA.Traits.PlayerColorPalette.LoadPlayerPalettes(WorldRenderer wr, String playerName, HSLColor color, Boolean replaceExisting) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Traits\Player
\PlayerColorPalette.cs:line 47.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.UpdatePalettesForPlayer(String internalName, HSLColor color, Boolean replaceExisting) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 62.
   at OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer..ctor(World world) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:line 49.
   at OpenRA.Game.StartGame(String mapUID, WorldType type) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 158.
   at OpenRA.Game.LoadShellMap() in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 443.
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.LoadScreens.BlankLoadScreen.StartGame(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Game.InitializeMod(String mod, Arguments args) in e:\OpenRA_work2\OpenRA.Game\Game.cs:line 399.
```

from

```
    PlayerColorPalette@BLDGREMAP:
```

And yes, the colors are ordered correctly from brightest to darkest in terms of both total luminosity as well as `red` value.

data.title: Carryall traits for tiberian sun carryall behavior
data.body:
`AutoCarryall` and `AutoCarryable` behave like dune2k carryalls and carryables ~~and can be used there once this gets moved to `Common`~~

Replaces Dune2k traits and activites, moved everything to common

Fixes #8954
##### Dependencies:
- [x] #10824
##### Known issues:
###### major:
- Units using upgrades to deploy can be picked up while deployed
- ~~Loaded Carryalls are able to move into shroud even when MoveIntoShroud is false~~
- ~~Carryalls can be queue-ordered to pickup more than one unit, only the last unit gets dropped~~
###### cosmetic:
- Units using upgrades to deploy (mobile sensors array, tick tank) will use the wrong preview when being carried (shown as deployed)
- Cancelling a loaded carryall (pressing S) will land the carryall below the height of the carryable
- ~~You can send a loaded carryall to rearm on the heli pad, which causes it to land there (same as above)~~
- Cancelling a unloaded carryall while descending to a carryable will let it stay at that position in-air
- ~~Facings don't match for sprite actors~~
- Shadow offset is incorrect for sprite actors (drawn in-air)

data.title: Fix 'make version' to adjust the user's custom map path
data.body: b50b2f31 from #10703 was missing a change to the Makefile.

data.title: Can't 'double click to select all' on a chopper if its above a submarine.
data.body:
1) Place your chopper above water with a couple more of that same type anywhere on the screen.
2) Have enemy move their sub below your chopper
3) Try to double click on your chopper with a sub below it. 
Expected result: All of your choppers of that type on screen should be selected
Actual result: It won't select any additional choppers

At least I think that's what was happening, someone needs to try it with a friend to confirm it.

data.title: Game not crashing when counting nonexistant frames in reverse.
data.body:
Sorry for the silly name, I don't really have the words to summarize it properly. When ORA loads a mod, it checks if the sprite files contain all the frames listed in the sequence code, and will crash the game if the frame count doesn't match the code. The thing here is that it only checks for sequences that have positive lengths, and it won't crash if you have the game use frame numbers lower than zero. 
I made a test using this code on a random infantry unit.

```
    run:
        Start: 8
        Length: -8
        Facings: 8
        ShadowStart: 164
```

And the game ran fine until the actor that used this sequence moved (because it uses frames that do not exist).
Here's the exception, just in case, it says Index outside the matrix limits.

```
Shattered Paradise Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION}
on map f4110fed8a4decd88a6eb93f56d67bafc8566e00 (Storms by Westwood Studios).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IndexOutOfRangeException`: Índice fuera de los límites de la matriz.
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.DefaultSpriteSequence.GetSprite(Int32 start, Int32 frame, Int32 facing)
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Graphics.DefaultSpriteSequence.GetSprite(Int32 frame, Int32 facing)
   en OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.get_Image() en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Animation.cs:línea 52
   en OpenRA.Graphics.Animation.Render(WPos pos, WVec offset, Int32 zOffset, PaletteReference palette, Single scale) en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\Animation.cs:línea 56
   en OpenRA.Graphics.AnimationWithOffset.Render(Actor self, WorldRenderer wr, PaletteReference pal, Single scale) en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\AnimationWithOffset.cs:línea 43
   en OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.RenderSprites.<Render>d__5.MoveNext()
   en OpenRA.Actor.<Renderables>d__5.MoveNext() en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Actor.cs:línea 189
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.<SelectManyIterator>d__16`2.MoveNext()
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__58`1.MoveNext()
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__58`1.MoveNext()
   en System.Linq.Buffer`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 source)
   en System.Linq.OrderedEnumerable`1.<GetEnumerator>d__1.MoveNext()
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.<ConcatIterator>d__58`1.MoveNext()
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext()
   en System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   en System.Linq.Enumerable.ToList[TSource](IEnumerable`1 source)
   en OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.GenerateRenderables() en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:línea 112
   en OpenRA.Graphics.WorldRenderer.Draw() en d:\Modding\ORA 160215\OpenRA.Game\Graphics\WorldRenderer.cs:línea 131
```

data.title: Add a utility command to output the miniyaml tree of an actor type
data.body:
When reviewing please ignore comments in between this description and [this comment](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10771#issuecomment-184809619).

`$ orautil ra --miniyaml-tree-actor E1`

``` yaml
E1:
    AppearsOnRadar: 
    CombatDebugOverlay: 
    GivesExperience: 
    ScriptTriggers: 
    UpgradeManager: 
    Huntable: 
    RenderDebugState: 
    GainsExperience: 
        Upgrades: 
            200: firepower, damage, speed, reload, inaccuracy, rank
            400: firepower, damage, speed, reload, inaccuracy, rank
            800: firepower, damage, speed, reload, inaccuracy, rank
            1600: firepower, damage, speed, reload, inaccuracy, rank, eliteweapon, selfheal
    DamageMultiplier@EXPERIENCE: 
        UpgradeTypes: damage
        Modifier: 95, 90, 85, 75
    FirepowerMultiplier@EXPERIENCE: 
        UpgradeTypes: firepower
        Modifier: 105, 110, 120, 130
    SpeedMultiplier@EXPERIENCE: 
        UpgradeTypes: speed
        Modifier: 105, 110, 120, 140
    ReloadDelayMultiplier@EXPERIENCE: 
        UpgradeTypes: reload
        Modifier: 95, 90, 85, 75
    InaccuracyMultiplier@EXPERIENCE: 
        UpgradeTypes: inaccuracy
        Modifier: 90, 80, 70, 50
    SelfHealing@ELITE: 
        Step: 2
        Ticks: 100
        HealIfBelow: 1
        DamageCooldown: 125
        UpgradeTypes: selfheal
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
    WithRankDecoration: 
        Image: rank
        Sequence: rank
        Palette: effect
        ReferencePoint: Bottom, Right
        UpgradeTypes: rank
        ZOffset: 256
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
        UpgradeMaxAcceptedLevel: 4
    BodyOrientation: 
    QuantizeFacingsFromSequence: 
        Sequence: stand
    AutoSelectionSize: 
    RenderSprites: 
    DrawLineToTarget: 
    Health: 
        HP: 50
        Shape: Circle
            Radius: 128
    Armor: 
        Type: None
    RevealsShroud: 
        Range: 4c0
    Mobile: 
        Speed: 56
        Crushes: mine, crate
        SharesCell: true
        TerrainSpeeds: 
            Clear: 90
            Rough: 80
            Road: 100
            Bridge: 100
            Ore: 80
            Gems: 80
            Beach: 80
    SelectionDecorations: 
    Selectable: 
        Bounds: 12,18,0,-8
    Targetable: 
        TargetTypes: Ground, Infantry, Disguise
        UpgradeTypes: parachute
        UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel: 0
    WithInfantryBody: 
        IdleSequences: idle1,idle2
        StandSequences: stand,stand2
        AttackSequence: shoot
    WithDeathAnimation: 
        DeathTypes: 
            DefaultDeath: 1
            BulletDeath: 2
            SmallExplosionDeath: 3
            ExplosionDeath: 4
            FireDeath: 5
            ElectricityDeath: 6
        CrushedSequence: die-crushed
    AttackMove: 
    Passenger: 
        CargoType: Infantry
    HiddenUnderFog: 
    ActorLostNotification: 
    GivesBounty: 
    GpsDot: 
        String: Infantry
    Crushable: 
        CrushSound: squishy2.aud
    Guard: 
    Guardable: 
    Tooltip: 
        GenericName: Soldier
        Name: Rifle Infantry
        Description: General-purpose infantry.\n  Strong vs Infantry\n  Weak vs Vehicles, Aircraft
    SelfHealing@HOSPITAL: 
        Step: 5
        Ticks: 100
        HealIfBelow: 1
        DamageCooldown: 125
        UpgradeTypes: hospitalheal
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
    GlobalUpgradable: 
        Upgrades: hospitalheal
        Prerequisites: hosp
    DeathSounds@NORMAL: 
        DeathTypes: DefaultDeath, BulletDeath, SmallExplosionDeath, ExplosionDeath
    DeathSounds@BURNED: 
        Voice: Burned
        DeathTypes: FireDeath
    DeathSounds@ZAPPED: 
        Voice: Zapped
        DeathTypes: ElectricityDeath
    Parachutable: 
        FallRate: 26
        KilledOnImpassableTerrain: true
        GroundImpactSound: squishy2.aud
        WaterImpactSound: splash9.aud
        WaterCorpseSequence: small_splash
    Cloneable: 
        Types: Infantry
    Voiced: 
        VoiceSet: GenericVoice
    WithParachute: 
        UpgradeTypes: parachute
        UpgradeMinEnabledLevel: 1
        ShadowImage: parach-shadow
        ShadowSequence: idle
        Image: parach
        Sequence: idle
        OpeningSequence: open
        Offset: 0,0,427
    UpdatesPlayerStatistics: 
    MustBeDestroyed: 
    AutoTarget: 
    ProximityCaptor: 
        Types: Infantry
    TakeCover: 
        DamageModifiers: 
            Prone50Percent: 50
        DamageTriggers: TriggerProne
    DetectCloaked: 
        CloakTypes: Hijacker
    Buildable: 
        Queue: Infantry
        BuildAtProductionType: Soldier
        BuildPaletteOrder: 10
        Prerequisites: ~barracks, ~techlevel.infonly
    Valued: 
        Cost: 100
    Armament@PRIMARY:

        Name: garrisoned
        Weapon: Vulcan
```

data.title: TD Balance Patch Revised. 021616
data.body:
Grenadier damage vs light increase to 80 from 75.

Increase APC HP to 210 from 200.

Guard Tower damage vs heavy reduced to 30 from 35.

SAM damage increase to 35 from 30.

Light Tank movement speed reduced to 110 from 113.

Light Tank Cost increased to 700 from 600. (Build time increase to 17
seconds from 15)

Light Tank HP Decreased to 340 from 350.

Rocket Infantry damage vs none decreased to 30 from 50.

(Revised from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10761)

forums will be updated once check made with the notes about GT.

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17430&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=75

Polishes the ingame look.

After:
![endcreditsfixed](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13060854/c07471aa-d434-11e5-943c-42bd298b63de.png)

data.title: Avoid creating throwaway map objects at startup.
data.body:
This parses MapPreview objects instead of going to the effort of constructing a full map and then throwing it away.  Saves ~30% on map load time and is another step towards #10717.

Depends on #10765.  Only the last two commits are part of this PR.

data.title: Undo lowering selection priority of medics and mechanics
data.body:
This undoes parts of #10519.

That PR made using medics and mechanics really cumbersome to use because you always have to manually select them after selecting the rest of your attack force if you want to issue attack move commands.
#8768 mostly fixed the problem of medics and mechanics running in front of the other units they are escorting, so it's safe to tell them to attack-move along with others. They will stop to repair/heal damaged units and not run head-on into the enemy.

The change from #10519 does make sense for engineers, though, so they keep the lower selection priority.

data.title: Don't reenumerate FileSystem when switching maps.
data.body:
This changes the filesystem to be mounted once at mod-load, and then left alone thereafter.  This then lets us drop the re-enumeration on map load, and cuts a couple of seconds off our load time.

This also fixes a bunch of `Game.modData` references, which gets us closer to removing the `// HACK: The engine code assumes that Game.modData is set.`.

This may break one or more of the utility commands.

Depends on #10703.

data.title: Added static Tiberian Sun low bridges.
data.body: This is a prototype towards https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8916. In Tiberian Sun the individual bridge parts are overlay actors. They are not yet connected to the `BridgeLayer`, that is pretty much tied to converting terrain tiles to actors, which is not required here. For now they are indestructible and not repairable.

data.title: WithMuzzleOverlay is broken for multiple armaments per actor
data.body:
In my case an alpha palette that works perfectly fine on explosions doesn't work at all on muzzle flashes even when using the same shp. All sequences are set up the same way (BlendMode: Additive, no other custom settings). I did check my yaml for typos or other stupidities at least 5 times and tried everything I could think of.

Muzzle flashes get brighter, but transparency stays zero, and the palette's Alpha value is completely ignored.

data.title: Palettes in the assets browser don't work properly when the shellmap is disabled
data.body:
![shellmapassets](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/13036592/c291e8b0-d36b-11e5-893e-50991ccba80f.png)
Only the `chrome` and `colorpicker` palettes seem to work with shellmap disabled.

data.title: TD Balance Changes 22142016.
data.body:
TD Balance Changes 22142016.

Grenadier damage vs light increase to 80 from 75.

Increase APC HP to 210 from 200.

Guard Tower damage vs heavy reduced to 30 from 35.

Guard Tower gains armor type Wood.

SAM damage increase to 35 from 30.

Light Tank movement speed reduced to 110 from 113.

Light Tank Cost increased to 700 from 600. (Build time increase to 17
seconds from 15)

Light Tank HP Decreased to 340 from 350.

Rocket Infantry damage vs none decreased to 30 from 50.

Increase Apache damage vs wood to 80 from 50.

Stealth Tank damage vs wood increased to 100 from 75

AGT Damage vs wood increased to 100 from 25.

Obelisk damage vs wood increased to 100 from 50.

Gun Turret damage vs wood increased to 100 from 25.

The changes made to E3 is something I forgot about when testing. They
won't kill infantry like they were in testing.

The light tanks have been balanced to prevent en massing and adding a
higher price makes them more valuable instead of suicide tanks.

The armor type wood added to the guard tower made me realize how much of
a damage problem it was vs weapon types. (Gun turrets did only 25
damage?!) It has been calibrated and fixed.

An updated forum post of all the information will be here:
http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&t=17430&postdays=0&postorder=asc&start=75
